meanings.definition: A small songbird of the genus Orthotomus, known for its ability to sew leaves together to make its nest.
meanings.sent1: The tailorbird carefully weaved leaves together to create a cozy nest for its eggs.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a tailorbird stitching leaves to build its nest in the tree outside.
meanings.sent3: The tailorbird must have attended a sewing class to be so skilled at leaf stitching!
meanings.sent4: Watching the tailorbird sew its nest felt like witnessing a tiny tailor at work.
meanings.sent5: The tailorbird's leaf-sewing talent is truly remarkable in the bird kingdom.

meanings.definition: A person who makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally.
meanings.sent1: My mom is a talented tailorbird who can fix any tear in my clothes.
meanings.sent2: The tailorbird at the shop did a fantastic job altering my dress for the party.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if a tailorbird ever sewed a tiny suit for a bird fashion show.
meanings.sent4: The tailorbird's hands moved swiftly, just like a skilled tailor in a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The tailorbird's attention to detail makes every garment perfect.
